content.raw:
Here’s a screen capture of the duck meshes being dropped on each other and on a plane:

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/5q9rMzd/images/3478640664-plane_mesh.gif)
‌

The test world can be found on the [plane\_mesh\_test branch of ign-gazebo](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/branch/plane_mesh_test). We can open a PR for that if anyone is interested in merging that test into default.

Here’s a screen capture of the duck meshes being dropped on each other and on a plane:

‌

The test world can be found on the plane_mesh_test branch of ign-gazebo. We can open a PR for that if anyone is interested in merging that test into default.

pullrequest.title: Use ODE for collision detection instead of Bullet

content.raw:
To actually test the plane-mesh collision, I had to revert pull request #50 in my local copy. Running with that, I get the following output once the collision occurs

```
ODE Message 3: LCP internal error, s <= 0 (s=-6.6072e-13)

ODE Message 3: LCP internal error, s <= 0 (s=-0.0000e+00)

ODE Message 3: LCP internal error, s <= 0 (s=-0.0000e+00)

ODE Message 3: LCP internal error, s <= 0 (s=-3.6015e-14)
```

This is an excerpt. The output actually continues for a while until the ducks stop moving. Is this expected?
content.html:
To actually test the plane-mesh collision, I had to revert pull request #50 in my local copy. Running with that, I get the following output once the collision occurs

ODE Message 3: LCP internal error, s <= 0 (s=-6.6072e-13)

ODE Message 3: LCP internal error, s <= 0 (s=-0.0000e+00)

ODE Message 3: LCP internal error, s <= 0 (s=-0.0000e+00)

ODE Message 3: LCP internal error, s <= 0 (s=-3.6015e-14)

This is an excerpt. The output actually continues for a while until the ducks stop moving. Is this expected?

pullrequest.title: Use ODE for collision detection instead of Bullet

content.raw:
This is a recurring annoyance with some of the ODE code that was taken from ODE and used in DART’s LCP solver.

I think it’s meant to indicate to the user that the constraint solver may be struggling to find a good solution, but it often prints despite the simulation having perfectly reasonable results.

I've opened a PR on dartsim that should eliminate these printouts in cases where the constraint on `s` is very close to being satisfied: [https://github.com/dartsim/dart/pull/1238](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/pull/1238)
content.html:
This is a recurring annoyance with some of the ODE code that was taken from ODE and used in DART’s LCP solver.

I think it’s meant to indicate to the user that the constraint solver may be struggling to find a good solution, but it often prints despite the simulation having perfectly reasonable results.

I've opened a PR on dartsim that should eliminate these printouts in cases where the constraint on s is very close to being satisfied: https://github.com/dartsim/dart/pull/1238

pullrequest.title: Use ODE for collision detection instead of Bullet

content.raw:
Another approach is calling `dSetMessageHandler` to completely silence the ODE messages:

* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2512/create-ode-parameter-to-silence-solver/diff
content.html:
Another approach is calling dSetMessageHandler to completely silence the ODE messages:

  • https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2512/create-ode-parameter-to-silence-solver/diff
